data.meta_description: Posts about Lost in poetry translation! written by Sana Shoukat
data.text:
Words have always been as life to me; such a thing which one adores, relishes and becomes a mad lover of. But the words clothed with the blood of betrayal have stained the gleaming fabric of my belief and have taken my madness to believe in them away. Being called a rose and being trained like a thorn, not anymore! Deciphering life at 2:21 AM with the gentle rain gracing the thirst-stricken boundaries of my house, my inner voice utters; deceiving with words must be their charm but deciphering their words should be yours. Take the plunge and donâ€™t be a prey to words which are not backed up by actions and doings. Be aware the next time you are being called a rose. You know what to do! ğŸ˜‰

The ones who have gone through my previous post â€˜Deciphering lifeâ€¦(1)â€™ must be aware that while deciphering life, I also decipher some favorite Urdu couplets to English translation. The place is again Panjpeer Rocks where not only birds sing but life too. Hope you find the cure through these couplets.

P.S: Only those credits have been given which I am sure of. Please give attribution if you know about the poets and the listed couplets. You can also drop in your favorite verses and couplets.

Deciphering life with words, regrets, love, deceit, prose and poetry. Nature and life are one and the same for me. Like a lover who takes pleasure in writing a love letter to the beloved, I take pleasure in writing a letter to the soul. Nature is my soul.

Like the dewdrops remain with petals, serenity with spring and a silver lining with clouds; nature remains with me as soul with body. While deciphering life, I have tried to blend poetry with nature; the best love letter in the making! These shots have been taken at the place called â€˜Panjpeerâ€™ near Kahuta in Rawalpindi district, Pakistan.

Here is a collection of a few favorite pieces of Urdu poetry along with a loose English translation.
